# Draft:Bhiwani-Narnaul-Alwar Line

----
The Bhiwani - Narnaul - Alwar new railway connection of the North Western Railway Zone is a  proposed link recommended in NCR Regional Plan 2041 wherein Orbital Rail Corridors (ORC) were proposed connecting various railway sections in NCR and diverting Non-essential traffic away from Delhi and decongesting existing railway lines. This missing link was proposed in ORC-III of the plan in the state of  Haryana and Rajasthan broadly recommending interconnecting these stations. There have been various proposals subsequent to which to interconnect Bhiwani-Loharu, Charkhi-dadri (on Rewari-Bhiwani Section) -Mahendragrah-Narnaul-Behror-Alwar, Jhajjar-Narnaul-Behror-Alwarn on these missing links in various stages of implementation in feasibility stages. These aim to inter-connect four Major Railway sections : Rewari-Bathinda Section, Rewari-Hanumangarh Section, Rewari-Ringas Section, Jaipur-Delhi Section in Delhi NCR. There are two proposals for the said connection : Bhiwani-Charkhidadri-Mahendragarh-Narnaul-Behror-Alwarand Jhajjar-Narnaul-Behror-Alwar.
History
The interconnection was  first conceptualised in 2008 and various routes were sent for feasibility status.
